OOC: That sounds pretty good, but I just watched the Terminator and it call=
ed him (The Terminator) a Cyborg, a Cybernetic Organism. The Terminator him=
self was like a machine with a free mind with organics on the outside. You =
might have it reversed, or else they do. I don't know...

  ----- Original =
Message -----
  From: LurkerAbyss
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
  Sent: Sund=
ay, August 18, 2002 9:15 PM
  Subject: Re: Owlhawk's training


  OOC:  I m=
ight be wrong, but I'm pretty sure that  the difference is that, an android=
 is  part organic, but is  truely techno.  And a cyborg, is part techno, bu=
t truely organic.  These are usually used for part-techno, part-human.  But=
 in transformers case, most would be "androids", because  they are original=
ly techno  but take on some organic.  But for transformers, wouldn't they b=
e called "techno-organic"?

  ---------------------------------------------=

gs.

r to the CR chamber.

side when she reached two

    > with her mech.
